column5: We are seeking a highly-motivated Technical Marketing Engineer to join Cisco's Cloud & Network Security Products organization.                         What You'll Do          Maintaining expertise on our product use cases, customer needs, market trends, and the threat landscape.    Having a deep understanding of how our product offerings integrate with Cisco's security portfolio and other components in our customers' security stack.    Telling stories that inspire passion and amplify our product opinions, vision/roadmap, and thought leadership.    Presenting and demoing at high profile industry events around the world, on webcasts and other digital events, and in conference rooms to C-level executives at the largest companies to help audiences understand our product capabilities and benefits.    Building, maintaining, and proctoring global labs and demo platforms for our product technology to establish it as the next standard for the security industry.    Researching and analyzing the competitive landscape and producing assets for our sellers.    Presenting to Cisco Sales & Partner SE teams about our latest use cases and capabilities.    Being part of a team that is the sales force's key contact to help technically close deals for our largest opportunities.    Knowing how the Network Security strategy aligns with Cisco's security strategy and products portfolio.                Who you’ll work with:            You'll be part of a fast-paced dynamic team in a rewarding environment, working closely with Product Management, Engineering, Product Marketing, UI/UX, and Sales Engineering to help drive the strategy, design, and deployment of Cisco’s security product family in our customers'                         Minimum Requirements:          10+ years in network security such as technical pre-sales, technical marketing, or customer success     5 years experience in network design and firewalls (Cisco Firepower, ASA, Palo Alto, Fortinet, Checkpoint)    CCNP security, CISSP/CCSP, or other security/networking certification/s.                Nice to Have:          Must be open to 10% global travel    Have a proven record of explaining new, disruptive solutions to enterprise customers-both the strategic benefits and practical use cases.    An engaging, charismatic presenter who's comfortable in front of audiences of all sizes and with both technical and non-technical buyers including C-level executives    Able to demonstrate your presentation and webcast/video recording expertise and share examples of your work.    Technically-savvy in setting up demo/lab environments and troubleshooting/overcoming issues in various network, endpoint, and cloud architectures.    Strong collaborator who can drive a product roadmap, sell a vision, and inspire effectively based on user research, business logic, and data.                Why Cisco            #WeAreCisco, where each person is unique. We bring our talents to work as a team each day, helping power an inclusive future for all. Get to know us!     We’re global, we’re adaptable, we’re diverse, and our security portfolio is as extensive as it is groundbreaking. Have you heard of Threat, Detection & Response, Zero Trust by Duo, Common Services Engineering, or Cloud & Network Security? Those are only a few of our product teams! The only thing we’re missing is YOU.        Join an enterprise security leader with a start-up culture, committed to driving innovation and giving you the opportunity to make an impact. We #InnovateToWin and we know we’re better together, that’s why we’re dedicated to inclusivity, collaboration, and diversity in everything we do.      We’re proud to be the Best Security Company in 2021 with the Best Authentication Technology and the Best Small and Mid-Size Enterprises Security Solution in 2022 by SC Media. Cisco Secure continues to grow and evolve year after year with 100% of Fortune 100 Companies using our products, and we’re excited to see the new heights we’ll reach with your passion for security, your customer focus, and your desire to change things up!     What else can you expect? An ongoing investment in your growth—that’s why we offer many employee resource groups (called Inclusive Communities), mentorship programs, and hundreds of learning resources to consistently level up your skillset and explore your interests. Because when you succeed, we succeed!     “Cisco Secure offers an environment that combines cutting-edge, mission-critical, technology with some of the brightest, most diverse set of people I’ve ever had the pleasure of working with.” – Chief of Staff, Engineering     Join Cisco Secure – Be You, With Us!  #CiscoSecureEng23

We are seeking a highly-motivated Technical Marketing Engineer to join Cisco's Cloud & Network Security Products organization.                         What You'll Do          Maintaining expertise on our product use cases, customer needs, market trends, and the threat landscape.    Having a deep understanding of how our product offerings integrate with Cisco's security portfolio and other components in our customers' security stack.    Telling stories that inspire passion and amplify our product opinions, vision/roadmap, and thought leadership.    Presenting and demoing at high profile industry events around the world, on webcasts and other digital events, and in conference rooms to C-level executives at the largest companies to help audiences understand our product capabilities and benefits.    Building, maintaining, and proctoring global labs and demo platforms for our product technology to establish it as the next standard for the security industry.    Researching and analyzing the competitive landscape and producing assets for our sellers.    Presenting to Cisco Sales & Partner SE teams about our latest use cases and capabilities.    Being part of a team that is the sales force's key contact to help technically close deals for our largest opportunities.    Knowing how the Network Security strategy aligns with Cisco's security strategy and products portfolio.                Who you’ll work with:            You'll be part of a fast-paced dynamic team in a rewarding environment, working closely with Product Management, Engineering, Product Marketing, UI/UX, and Sales Engineering to help drive the strategy, design, and deployment of Cisco’s security product family in our customers'                         Minimum Requirements:          10+ years in network security such as technical pre-sales, technical marketing, or customer success     5 years experience in network design and firewalls (Cisco Firepower, ASA, Palo Alto, Fortinet, Checkpoint)    CCNP security, CISSP/CCSP, or other security/networking certification/s.                Nice to Have:          Must be open to 10% global travel    Have a proven record of explaining new, disruptive solutions to enterprise customers-both the strategic benefits and practical use cases.    An engaging, charismatic presenter who's comfortable in front of audiences of all sizes and with both technical and non-technical buyers including C-level executives    Able to demonstrate your presentation and webcast/video recording expertise and share examples of your work.    Technically-savvy in setting up demo/lab environments and troubleshooting/overcoming issues in various network, endpoint, and cloud architectures.    Strong collaborator who can drive a product roadmap, sell a vision, and inspire effectively based on user research, business logic, and data.                Why Cisco            #WeAreCisco, where each person is unique. We bring our talents to work as a team each day, helping power an inclusive future for all. Get to know us!     We’re global, we’re adaptable, we’re diverse, and our security portfolio is as extensive as it is groundbreaking. Have you heard of Threat, Detection & Response, Zero Trust by Duo, Common Services Engineering, or Cloud & Network Security? Those are only a few of our product teams! The only thing we’re missing is YOU.        Join an enterprise security leader with a start-up culture, committed to driving innovation and giving you the opportunity to make an impact. We #InnovateToWin and we know we’re better together, that’s why we’re dedicated to inclusivity, collaboration, and diversity in everything we do.      We’re proud to be the Best Security Company in 2021 with the Best Authentication Technology and the Best Small and Mid-Size Enterprises Security Solution in 2022 by SC Media. Cisco Secure continues to grow and evolve year after year with 100% of Fortune 100 Companies using our products, and we’re excited to see the new heights we’ll reach with your passion for security, your customer focus, and your desire to change things up!     What else can you expect? An ongoing investment in your growth—that’s why we offer many employee resource groups (called Inclusive Communities), mentorship programs, and hundreds of learning resources to consistently level up your skillset and explore your interests. Because when you succeed, we succeed!     “Cisco Secure offers an environment that combines cutting-edge, mission-critical, technology with some of the brightest, most diverse set of people I’ve ever had the pleasure of working with.” – Chief of Staff, Engineering     Join Cisco Secure – Be You, With Us!  #CiscoSecureEng23Test Engineer We are seeking Test and Q/A Engineer to support testing and software quality validation on Cisco IoT wireless/routing products and solutions. What You'll Do You will be part of a Team involved in development/testing of software on Polaris & Cheetah based platforms, that may include any of the following list of responsibilities:  Understands system hardware and software architectures, design concepts, and engineering development practices Support the new platform software development tests, system tests, solution tests and regression tests across enterprise products and solutions Develop code for testing automation Collaborate with Development Team, Marketing, TAC, Customers, and Partners to understand product requirements, review function specification, write test plan, find bugs and validate solutions Collaborate with Team members for efficient execution, ensure the on-time delivery of the products with high quality Support escalations and issues to keep high customer satisfaction  Who You Are Good knowledge of TCP/IP networking technologies.Good knowledge of L2/L3 networking protocols.Good knowledge of wireless communication protocols.Hands-on experience on Linux or Unix.Software Programming / High level language proficiency (ex: Python, C, C++, bash).Hands-on automation test experience.Good written, verbal, and presentation skills in English.High level of motivation and energy.Inter-personal and collaboration skills are essential.Hands-on experience with Cisco IOS is a plus.Project management skills a plus.A Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree preferably in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, related majors such as Math, Physics.

We believe that when passionate people are able to spend less time struggling with technology, they can spend more time on what matters - like teaching children, running businesses, keeping airports safe, and connecting disaster victims with relief. That’s the real power of simplicity. Cisco Meraki is the leader in cloud-managed IT, thanks to our creative, inclusive, fearless team that is driven to simplify technology so the world can simply work!                                         Cisco Meraki has grown to become an industry leader in the IT space, with over 500,000 plus  customers and with over 3 million active networks and counting around the world. We have a comprehensive set of solutions which allows customers to seize new business opportunities and reduce operational costs. Meraki is known for simplifying powerful technology through our products and services - and for the people behind them. As the fastest growing cloud-managed networking team in the world, our products and technology architecture are changing the face of networking and making cloud-managed IT a reality.                          WHAT YOU'LL OWN                    ·                                     Be the “go-to” expert on RF manufacturing tests.                    ·                                     Work onsite with JDMs & other vendors to bring-up new RF test processes, as needed.                    ·                                     Encourage and require the JDMs to document & follow standard processes for NPI, Sustaining & RMA activities.                    ·                                     Enforce & review SoP docs and SPC specs (Yield, Cpk, GR&R), during production phase transitions and periodically for sustaining production.                    ·                                     Conduct audits of factory processes, with focus on the RF portions of the production line.                    ·                                     Provide oversight & guidance during critical production stages.                                         WHAT YOU BRING                    ·                                     5+ years of experience at an electronics manufacturing factory, preferably on all aspects of RF testing for BLE, WiFi, LTE & 5G products.                    ·                                     Hands-on experience in troubleshooting RF issues.                    ·                                     High comfort level in using RF test instrumentation such as Network Analyzer, Spectrum Analyzer, various types of power meters, one-box testers from LightPoint or Keysight, LTE/5G testers such as the R&S CMW500 or Keysight’s UXM series.                    ·                                     Working knowledge of statistical methods (SPC, AQL), as used in a Mfg. context.                    ·                                     Working familiarity with networking concepts (LAN vs. WAN, DHCP, DNS) to troubleshoot network connectivity issues.                    ·                                     Clarity in documenting issues. Persistence in following up on root cause analysis & corrective actions by responsible parties.                    ·                                     Excellent communication skills with internal teams and external partners.                    ·                                     Position is based in Taiwan but must be willing to travel around the Asia/Pacific region and occasionally to the US.                    ·                                     BS/MS in IE/EE/ME/CS or equivalent.                                         BONUS                    ·                                     Proficiency in Google Docs / MS Office                    ·                                     Knowledge of any programming language (preferably scripting), for ad hoc testing of product issues.                    ·                                     Mandarin & English language skills                    At Cisco Meraki, we’re challenging the status quo with the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. When we connect different perspectives, we can imagine new possibilities, inspire innovation, and release the full potential of our people. We’re building an employee experience that includes appreciation, belonging, growth, and purpose for everyone.                                         Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.                                                    Expression of Interest - Software Engineer          Cisco Systems Australia Pty Ltd  Application Date open from 17 February 2023 to 16 March 2023  Role Type - Full Time  Location - Brisbane, Australia            WHAT YOU'LL DO  You'll help us build the next generation of the lean manufacturing and security platform for enabling optimization in the testing of all Cisco products. The Technology and Quality Systems Group seeks a motivated, experienced Senior Software Engineer to lead, design and develop a broad range of next generation features as part of its virtual manufacturing execution and security platform. The foundational features of the next generation platform are solidly in place. This is an opportunity to lead in the next phase of product development. You will be collaborating with Test Engineering and Manufacturing organizations to enable key features for upcoming new products.                  WHO YOU ARE  You've got experience designing and implementing complex software systems. You are a top-tier expert in python programming and are passionate about unleashing your knowledge to develop creative products. You are conversant with agile development methodologies and work well in a team environment. You have good analytic and decision-making skills. Your strong communication skills help you influence others. Our minimum requirements for this role:                    More than 5 years software development experience.       Providing software support to our existing and potential clients.       Identifying technology limitations in existing systems and associated processes, procedures and methods.       Developing software customizations and maintaining technical program, helping clients to adapt the existing program to meet their criteria and needs.       Testing, debugging, diagnosing and correcting software errors in applications.       Ensuring programs and applications perform to specification       Providing inputs and insights in developing proposals and strategies for software designs       Strong technical and leadership skills to understand customer solutions, topologies and interactions in a multi-functional development environment.                        WHY CISCO  At Cisco, each person brings their rare talents to work as a team and make a difference.          Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people.          -  We connect everything – people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better.          - We innovate everywhere - From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more.          - We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities.          Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.          Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records          Colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco

An ongoing investment in your growth—that’s why we offer many employee resource groups (called Inclusive Communities), mentorship programs, and hundreds of learning resources to consistently level up your skillset and explore your interests. Because when you succeed, we succeed!     “Cisco Secure offers an environment that combines cutting-edge, mission-critical, technology with some of the brightest, most diverse set of people I’ve ever had the pleasure of working with.” – Chief of Staff, Engineering     Join Cisco Secure – Be You, With Us!  #CiscoSecureEng23Test Engineer We are seeking Test and Q/A Engineer to support testing and software quality validation on Cisco IoT wireless/routing products and solutions. What You'll Do You will be part of a Team involved in development/testing of software on Polaris & Cheetah based platforms, that may include any of the following list of responsibilities:  Understands system hardware and software architectures, design concepts, and engineering development practices Support the new platform software development tests, system tests, solution tests and regression tests across enterprise products and solutions Develop code for testing automation Collaborate with Development Team, Marketing, TAC, Customers, and Partners to understand product requirements, review function specification, write test plan, find bugs and validate solutions Collaborate with Team members for efficient execution, ensure the on-time delivery of the products with high quality Support escalations and issues to keep high customer satisfaction  Who You Are Good knowledge of TCP/IP networking technologies.Good knowledge of L2/L3 networking protocols.Good knowledge of wireless communication protocols.Hands-on experience on Linux or Unix.Software Programming / High level language proficiency (ex: Python, C, C++, bash).Hands-on automation test experience.Good written, verbal, and presentation skills in English.High level of motivation and energy.Inter-personal and collaboration skills are essential.Hands-on experience with Cisco IOS is a plus.Project management skills a plus.A Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree preferably in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, related majors such as Math, Physics.                    We believe that when passionate people are able to spend less time struggling with technology, they can spend more time on what matters - like teaching children, running businesses, keeping airports safe, and connecting disaster victims with relief. That’s the real power of simplicity. Cisco Meraki is the leader in cloud-managed IT, thanks to our creative, inclusive, fearless team that is driven to simplify technology so the world can simply work!                                         Cisco Meraki has grown to become an industry leader in the IT space, with over 500,000 plus  customers and with over 3 million active networks and counting around the world. We have a comprehensive set of solutions which allows customers to seize new business opportunities and reduce operational costs. Meraki is known for simplifying powerful technology through our products and services - and for the people behind them. As the fastest growing cloud-managed networking team in the world, our products and technology architecture are changing the face of networking and making cloud-managed IT a reality.                          WHAT YOU'LL OWN                    ·                                     Be the “go-to” expert on RF manufacturing tests.                    ·                                     Work onsite with JDMs & other vendors to bring-up new RF test processes, as needed.                    ·                                     Encourage and require the JDMs to document & follow standard processes for NPI, Sustaining & RMA activities.                    ·                                     Enforce & review SoP docs and SPC specs (Yield, Cpk, GR&R), during production phase transitions and periodically for sustaining production.                    ·                                     Conduct audits of factory processes, with focus on the RF portions of the production line.                    ·                                     Provide oversight & guidance during critical production stages.                                         WHAT YOU BRING                    ·                                     5+ years of experience at an electronics manufacturing factory, preferably on all aspects of RF testing for BLE, WiFi, LTE & 5G products.                    ·                                     Hands-on experience in troubleshooting RF issues.                    ·                                     High comfort level in using RF test instrumentation such as Network Analyzer, Spectrum Analyzer, various types of power meters, one-box testers from LightPoint or Keysight, LTE/5G testers such as the R&S CMW500 or Keysight’s UXM series.                    ·                                     Working knowledge of statistical methods (SPC, AQL), as used in a Mfg. context.                    ·                                     Working familiarity with networking concepts (LAN vs. WAN, DHCP, DNS) to troubleshoot network connectivity issues.                    ·                                     Clarity in documenting issues. Persistence in following up on root cause analysis & corrective actions by responsible parties.                    ·                                     Excellent communication skills with internal teams and external partners.                    ·                                     Position is based in Taiwan but must be willing to travel around the Asia/Pacific region and occasionally to the US.                    ·                                     BS/MS in IE/EE/ME/CS or equivalent.                                         BONUS                    ·                                     Proficiency in Google Docs / MS Office                    ·                                     Knowledge of any programming language (preferably scripting), for ad hoc testing of product issues.                    ·                                     Mandarin & English language skills                    At Cisco Meraki, we’re challenging the status quo with the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. When we connect different perspectives, we can imagine new possibilities, inspire innovation, and release the full potential of our people. We’re building an employee experience that includes appreciation, belonging, growth, and purpose for everyone.                                         Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.                                                    Expression of Interest - Software Engineer          Cisco Systems Australia Pty Ltd  Application Date open from 17 February 2023 to 16 March 2023  Role Type - Full Time  Location - Brisbane, Australia            WHAT YOU'LL DO  You'll help us build the next generation of the lean manufacturing and security platform for enabling optimization in the testing of all Cisco products. The Technology and Quality Systems Group seeks a motivated, experienced Senior Software Engineer to lead, design and develop a broad range of next generation features as part of its virtual manufacturing execution and security platform. The foundational features of the next generation platform are solidly in place. This is an opportunity to lead in the next phase of product development. You will be collaborating with Test Engineering and Manufacturing organizations to enable key features for upcoming new products.                  WHO YOU ARE  You've got experience designing and implementing complex software systems. You are a top-tier expert in python programming and are passionate about unleashing your knowledge to develop creative products. You are conversant with agile development methodologies and work well in a team environment. You have good analytic and decision-making skills. Your strong communication skills help you influence others. Our minimum requirements for this role:                    More than 5 years software development experience.       Providing software support to our existing and potential clients.       Identifying technology limitations in existing systems and associated processes, procedures and methods.       Developing software customizations and maintaining technical program, helping clients to adapt the existing program to meet their criteria and needs.       Testing, debugging, diagnosing and correcting software errors in applications.       Ensuring programs and applications perform to specification       Providing inputs and insights in developing proposals and strategies for software designs       Strong technical and leadership skills to understand customer solutions, topologies and interactions in a multi-functional development environment.                        WHY CISCO  At Cisco, each person brings their rare talents to work as a team and make a difference.          Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people.          -  We connect everything – people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better.          - We innovate everywhere - From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more.          - We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities.          Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.          Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records          Colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco                            What You’ll Do              You'll be working in the API team, our goal is to deliver a global and reliable public API where our customers can take full advantage of our state of the art real-time network monitoring technology that measures, correlates, and visualizes synthetic data about global network conditions.              As a Software Engineer on this team, you will be responsible for designing and implementing a reliable public API with a focus on security, performance and scale to help meet the requirements of our Enterprise customers and help engineering teams deliver the best in class public API for networking monitoring data.              What We're Looking For                                Understanding of object-oriented programming languages such as Java, Kotlin, Scala, etc.                                      Solid Computer Science fundamentals and object-oriented design skills.                                      Strong collaboration and communication skills.                                      Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or similar.

We are seeking a highly-motivated Technical Marketing Engineer to join Cisco's Cloud & Network Security Products organization.                         What You'll Do          Maintaining expertise on our product use cases, customer needs, market trends, and the threat landscape.    Having a deep understanding of how our product offerings integrate with Cisco's security portfolio and other components in our customers' security stack.    Telling stories that inspire passion and amplify our product opinions, vision/roadmap, and thought leadership.    Presenting and demoing at high profile industry events around the world, on webcasts and other digital events, and in conference rooms to C-level executives at the largest companies to help audiences understand our product capabilities and benefits.    Building, maintaining, and proctoring global labs and demo platforms for our product technology to establish it as the next standard for the security industry.    Researching and analyzing the competitive landscape and producing assets for our sellers.    Presenting to Cisco Sales & Partner SE teams about our latest use cases and capabilities.    Being part of a team that is the sales force's key contact to help technically close deals for our largest opportunities.    Knowing how the Network Security strategy aligns with Cisco's security strategy and products portfolio.                Who you’ll work with:            You'll be part of a fast-paced dynamic team in a rewarding environment, working closely with Product Management, Engineering, Product Marketing, UI/UX, and Sales Engineering to help drive the strategy, design, and deployment of Cisco’s security product family in our customers'                         Minimum Requirements:          10+ years in network security such as technical pre-sales, technical marketing, or customer success     5 years experience in network design and firewalls (Cisco Firepower, ASA, Palo Alto, Fortinet, Checkpoint)    CCNP security, CISSP/CCSP, or other security/networking certification/s.                Nice to Have:          Must be open to 10% global travel    Have a proven record of explaining new, disruptive solutions to enterprise customers-both the strategic benefits and practical use cases.    An engaging, charismatic presenter who's comfortable in front of audiences of all sizes and with both technical and non-technical buyers including C-level executives    Able to demonstrate your presentation and webcast/video recording expertise and share examples of your work.    Technically-savvy in setting up demo/lab environments and troubleshooting/overcoming issues in various network, endpoint, and cloud architectures.    Strong collaborator who can drive a product roadmap, sell a vision, and inspire effectively based on user research, business logic, and data.                Why Cisco            #WeAreCisco, where each person is unique. We bring our talents to work as a team each day, helping power an inclusive future for all. Get to know us!     We’re global, we’re adaptable, we’re diverse, and our security portfolio is as extensive as it is groundbreaking. Have you heard of Threat, Detection & Response, Zero Trust by Duo, Common Services Engineering, or Cloud & Network Security? Those are only a few of our product teams! The only thing we’re missing is YOU.        Join an enterprise security leader with a start-up culture, committed to driving innovation and giving you the opportunity to make an impact. At Cisco Meraki, we know that technology can connect, empower, and drive us! Our mission is to simplify technology so our customers can focus on what's most meaningful to them: their students, patients, customers, and businesses. We’re making networking easier, faster, with technology that simply works! As a Senior Security Engineer, you will work closely with the Manager of the Governance, Risk and Compliance Program. The role will coordinate the Meraki program in alignment with established Security policies, standards, methodologies, and processes. You will lead and drive assessments to ensure compliance with internal and external requirements, identifying risks, and communicating the posture to the Meraki leadership team. You will also act as the domain specialist for Security Governance, Risk, and Compliance. Key responsibilities:  Assist and influence management in the development, evolution, and execution of security risk strategies. Take the lead in the creation effort of the Information Security Risk Program by crafting a Security Risk Assessment methodology, policy, strategy, and process. Proactively work with local and remote Security teams and business owners to define the risk roadmap and program direction. Communicate and advocate for security enhancements and continuous improvements. Lead gap and risk assessments to identify and document significant information security risks associated with all aspects of Meraki systems, data, and infrastructure. Partner with Engineering leadership on the development, and review of IT initiatives and Security controls to identify operational efficiency. Lead remediation efforts and document completion status of deficiencies. Advance GRC and other Security tools to collect, maintain and share security risk information with senior leadership. Serve as a project lead by providing professional and expert-level security consulting services to business owners and partners. Maintain broad knowledge of standard methodologies and trends in the field of Information Security and other technologies relevant to systems operated by the Operations teams. Find opportunities for collaboration, inclusion, and alignment across the security program. Act as a mentor and train other security analysts.  You are an ideal candidate if you have:  Extensive experience implementing and assessing security in a cloud-hosted environment. High-level of knowledge of security technologies, information systems, and risk assessment methodologies. Desire to learn new and evolving technologies in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate will have at least 8+ years of working within the technical arena with 5+ years of information security work experience. Technical background in IT systems and networking in Cloud environments. Experience analyzing vulnerability assessment reports and data and writing risk mitigation plans according to the assessment.   Must have the ability to lead and collaborate with technical and non-technical teams to further the goals and mission of the Security Risk and Compliance team Excellent written and oral communication skills, as well as interpersonal skills including the ability to articulate to both technical and non-technical audiences. Experience in security standards such as ISO 27001, 27002, 27005; NIST, COBIT, ITIL, PCI   At Cisco Meraki, we’re challenging the status quo with the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. When we connect different perspectives, we can imagine new possibilities, inspire innovation, and release the full potential of our people. We’re building an employee experience that includes appreciation, belonging, growth, and purpose for everyone. Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Message to applicants applying to work in the U.S.: When available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire salaries in U.S. locations. For non-sales roles, the hiring ranges reflect base salary and do not include bonuses, equity, or benefits. Hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive target, and do not include equity or benefits. Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications or training. Applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their U.S. hiring location. The recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.

At Cisco Meraki, we know that technology can connect, empower, and drive us! Our mission is to simplify technology so our customers can focus on what's most meaningful to them: their students, patients, customers, and businesses. We’re making networking easier, faster, with technology that simply works! As a Senior Security Engineer, you will work closely with the Manager of the Governance, Risk and Compliance Program. The role will coordinate the Meraki program in alignment with established Security policies, standards, methodologies, and processes. You will lead and drive assessments to ensure compliance with internal and external requirements, identifying risks, and communicating the posture to the Meraki leadership team. You will also act as the domain specialist for Security Governance, Risk, and Compliance. Key responsibilities:  Assist and influence management in the development, evolution, and execution of security risk strategies. Take the lead in the creation effort of the Information Security Risk Program by crafting a Security Risk Assessment methodology, policy, strategy, and process. Proactively work with local and remote Security teams and business owners to define the risk roadmap and program direction. Communicate and advocate for security enhancements and continuous improvements. Lead gap and risk assessments to identify and document significant information security risks associated with all aspects of Meraki systems, data, and infrastructure. Partner with Engineering leadership on the development, and review of IT initiatives and Security controls to identify operational efficiency. Lead remediation efforts and document completion status of deficiencies. Advance GRC and other Security tools to collect, maintain and share security risk information with senior leadership. Serve as a project lead by providing professional and expert-level security consulting services to business owners and partners. Maintain broad knowledge of standard methodologies and trends in the field of Information Security and other technologies relevant to systems operated by the Operations teams. Find opportunities for collaboration, inclusion, and alignment across the security program. Act as a mentor and train other security analysts.  You are an ideal candidate if you have:  Extensive experience implementing and assessing security in a cloud-hosted environment. High-level of knowledge of security technologies, information systems, and risk assessment methodologies. Desire to learn new and evolving technologies in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate will have at least 8+ years of working within the technical arena with 5+ years of information security work experience. Technical background in IT systems and networking in Cloud environments. Experience analyzing vulnerability assessment reports and data and writing risk mitigation plans according to the assessment.   Must have the ability to lead and collaborate with technical and non-technical teams to further the goals and mission of the Security Risk and Compliance team Excellent written and oral communication skills, as well as interpersonal skills including the ability to articulate to both technical and non-technical audiences. Experience in security standards such as ISO 27001, 27002, 27005; NIST, COBIT, ITIL, PCI   At Cisco Meraki, we’re challenging the status quo with the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. The recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.   What Will You Do  Join the SD-WAN Management plane (vManage) team. This team is responsible for a critical surface area of the SDWAN fabric that operates globally at a massive scale. You will work on distributed systems for managing the market-leading Cisco SDWAN solution at scale. You will have the opportunity to design and implement inventive solutions for the architectural complexities involved in allowing vManage (a centralized management controller for the entire network) to operate at hyperscale. You will actively work on project teams with other highly skilled engineers involved in the software development for vManage.  You will design and deliver new software and features in Enterprise networking management systems. Day to day activities will involve crafting new features, understanding features in a results-oriented product, and proposing solutions that work for our platform, writing functional and design specifications, programming, unit and integration testing your code, helping review specifications and code for other software engineers on the team, and helping documentation team with the configuration aspects of your features.  Who you’ll Work With  Be part of an outstanding Software Engineering team that works on various ground- breaking technologies in Distributed Systems infrastructure and Cloud-deployed applications for Network Management in Cisco’s SD-WAN solution.  Who Are You  You are motivated, driven and a teammate. You are willing to learn and be passionate about working on a wide range of product areas. You work well independently and as part of a team and have strong communication skills. You have a strong background in software development including specification, implementation, and testing and strong design/programming skills. You own what you build and are able to ensure and commit to a high standard of quality in the face of time-to-market pressures. From a technical point of view, you should have       Minimum of 6 -12 year’s experience    in implementing dynamic large-scale, multi-tenant, distributed systems using Java/Cloud (AWS, Azure) environments and in building backend services for distributed systems    Experience in building and deploying Microservices on containers such as Docker, Kubernetes    Hands-on and deep knowledge of document-oriented Elasticsearch database is MUST     Hands-on Java/J2EE development experience and/or Golang development experience    Experience with clustering technologies, Kubernetes, Kafka/NATS and Elasticsearch are pluses    Be able to work with Production Support to assist with troubleshooting service stability, message topic or delivery issues, perform data-related benchmarking, performance analysis and tuning    Be willing to work under tight timelines and minimum supervision.
